summary: Address mechanical clarity gaps in core rules chapters (Actions, Character Creation, Combat) by adding concrete DC ranges, procedural breakdowns, and Clock advancement rates to improve Persona Fit and Usability scores.

target_issues.description: DC guidelines lack concrete number ranges; Partial Success outcomes leave too much to GM interpretation; Strike outcomes lack specific mechanical definitions
target_issues.improvement_goal: Players and GMs can determine appropriate DC and interpret outcomes without ambiguity
target_issues.success_metric: DC ladder table with 6 tiers (12-22); Outcome tier definitions with margin ranges; 3+ worked examples showing resolution

target_issues.description: Character creation optimization pathways unclear; attribute allocation guidance sparse; creation flow requires cross-referencing other chapters
target_issues.improvement_goal: New players can complete character creation without referencing other chapters
target_issues.success_metric: Self-contained attribute guidance; numbered checklist format; 2 complete worked examples with decision rationale

target_issues.description: Action economy described conceptually rather than procedurally; Resolve Clock advancement rates undefined; insufficient tactical depth
target_issues.improvement_goal: Combat rounds have clear procedural structure with defined Clock tick rates
target_issues.success_metric: Step-by-step round procedure; Resolve Clock tick table (outcome -> ticks); Action type quick-reference

target_issues.description: Clock advancement triggers described narratively without mechanical specifics; Tag mechanical effects on Checks inconsistent; Condition effects need quick reference
target_issues.improvement_goal: Clear mechanical triggers for Clock advancement and Tag/Condition effects
target_issues.success_metric: Clock advancement table by outcome; Tag effect summary (Edge/Burden grants); Condition quick-reference with clearing methods

modifications.instruction: Add a 'Standard DC Ladder' table with 6 tiers: Easy (DC 12), Routine (DC 14), Tough (DC 16), Hard (DC 18), Heroic (DC 20), Legendary (DC 22). Include a 'When to Use' column with concrete examples for each tier.
modifications.success_criteria: Table includes all 6 DC tiers with situational examples; GM can select DC without interpretation

modifications.instruction: Rewrite outcome tiers with explicit margin ranges: Critical Success (+5 or more), Full Success (0 to +4), Partial Success (-1 to -2), Failure (-3 to -6), Critical Failure (-7 or worse). Add a table summarizing these ranges.
modifications.success_criteria: Each outcome tier has numeric margin range; no ambiguity about which tier applies

modifications.instruction: Add 3 fully worked examples showing: 1) A social check with Partial Success cost negotiation, 2) A combat check with Clear Strike outcome and Clock ticks, 3) A skill check with Edge/Burden modifiers. Show dice rolled, math, outcome tier, and narrative result.
modifications.success_criteria: Each example shows full mechanical sequence: intent, DC, roll, margin, outcome, fiction

modifications.instruction: Define Strike outcomes mechanically: Clear Strike (Full Success) ticks target Resolve Clock by 2; Glancing Strike (Partial Success) ticks by 1 with counterattack opportunity; Miss advances threat Clock or grants enemy positioning.
modifications.success_criteria: Strike outcomes have specific Clock tick values; consequences are mechanical not narrative

modifications.instruction: Convert the prose description into a numbered checklist format. Each step should be self-contained with inline guidance. Remove references to 'see Chapter X' and incorporate essential information directly.
modifications.success_criteria: All 9 steps are numbered; each step can be completed without leaving the chapter

modifications.instruction: Add an 'Attribute Priorities by Archetype' sidebar showing common builds: Physical (MIG primary), Agile (AGI primary), Social (PRE primary), Analytical (RSN primary). Include recommended secondary attributes and example character concepts for each.
modifications.success_criteria: 4 archetype examples with primary/secondary attribute recommendations; new players can select attributes confidently

modifications.instruction: Expand to include 2 complete worked examples: one combat-focused character (MIG/AGI), one social/investigative character (PRE/RSN). Show decision rationale at each step, not just final choices.
modifications.success_criteria: 2 distinct character examples with annotated decision points; rationale explains WHY not just WHAT

modifications.instruction: Add a numbered 'Combat Round Procedure' with clear steps: 1) Establish turn order, 2) Active character declares intent and approach, 3) GM sets DC and modifiers, 4) Resolve Check, 5) Apply outcomes (damage, Clock ticks, Conditions), 6) Update fiction, 7) Next character.
modifications.success_criteria: 7-step procedure with no ambiguity about sequence; new GMs can run combat following steps

modifications.instruction: Add 'Resolve Clock Tick Rates' table: Critical Success (2-3 ticks), Full Success (2 ticks), Partial Success (1 tick + complication), Failure (0 ticks, may tick threat Clock). Include Resolve Clock size guidelines: Minor threat (4-segment), Standard (6-segment), Major (8-segment).
modifications.success_criteria: Table covers all outcome tiers with tick values; Clock sizing has concrete guidelines

modifications.instruction: Add 'Action Types Quick Reference' table listing Strike, Maneuver, Set Up, Defend, and other actions with: Primary Attribute, Typical DC, Success Effect, Partial Effect. Keep to one-line summaries.
modifications.success_criteria: Table fits on one page; players can reference action options at-a-glance

modifications.instruction: Add 'Clock Advancement by Check Outcome' table: Critical Success (2-3 segments), Full Success (1-2 segments), Partial Success (1 segment + complication), Failure (0 segments or tick opposing Clock). Note that specific actions may override these defaults.
modifications.success_criteria: Table provides default tick rates; GM has mechanical baseline before applying judgment

modifications.instruction: Clarify how Tags mechanically affect Checks. Add a 'Common Tag Effects' summary: Environmental Tags typically grant Edge or impose Burden based on relevance (e.g., *Dim Light* imposes Burden on sight-based Checks, grants Edge on Stealth). Provide 5-6 common Tag examples.
modifications.success_criteria: Clear Edge/Burden mapping for common Tags; players understand Tags as mechanical modifiers

modifications.instruction: Add 'Condition Quick Reference' table listing common Conditions with: Mechanical Effect (Edge/Burden/specific penalty), Clearing Method, Example Source. Include: *Exhausted*, *Bleeding*, *Frightened*, *Disarmed*, *Prone*.
modifications.success_criteria: 5+ Conditions with mechanical effects and clearing methods in table format

execution_order.rationale: Highest severity issue (10); foundational mechanics referenced by other chapters; DC and outcome definitions needed before combat/creation improvements
Clock advancement rates needed before combat chapter modifications; Tag/Condition mechanics support both creation and combat
Depends on Chapter 8 outcome definitions and Chapter 9 Clock rates; can now reference established mechanics
Can incorporate finalized mechanics references; self-contained creation flow benefits from settled core rules

estimated_impact.expected_improvement: +1.5-2.0 points for Usability (6.2 -> 7.7-8.2); +1.0 point for Persona Fit through clearer mechanics
secondary_benefits: Improved Rules Accuracy perception through explicit definitions
Better Clarity through tables and quick-references
Reduced GM cognitive load with procedural guidance

review_cycle_recommendation.rationale: Changes target mechanical clarity issues affecting multiple persona types; all personas should see improvement from explicit definitions and quick-references
